channel.title: CLF Quest
channel.itunes:author: Church of the Larger Fellowship - Unitarian Universalist
channel.description: Unitarian Universalist sermons, meditations, educational resources and comments from "Quest," the monthly publication of the Church of the Larger Fellowship. The CLF is a virtual UU congregation of more than 3,000 Unitarian Universalists isolated by geography or choice. We minister to each other through our presence on the web, small group ministries via email, open conversations on our CLF List, prison pen-pals program, and Quest, which you can hear on this podcast. For more information, or to support our work in the world, call us at (617) 948-6166 or visit us on the web at clfuu.org.
channel.itunes:subtitle: The monthly publication of the Church of the Larger Fellowship Unitarian Universalist
channel.itunes:summary: Unitarian Universalist sermons, meditations, educational resources and comments from "Quest," the monthly publication of the Church of the Larger Fellowship. The CLF is a virtual UU congregation of more than 2800 Unitarian Universalists isolated by geography or choice. We minister to each other through our presence on the web, small group ministries via email, open conversations on our CLF List, prison pen-pals program, and Quest, which you can hear on this podcast. For more information, call us at (617) 948-6166 or visit us on the web at clfuu.org.

itunes:owner.itunes:name: Church of the Larger Fellowship - Unitarian Universalist

item.title: CLF Quest June 2012: The Transcendent Within
item.itunes:author: Jaco B. ten Hove, Co-Minister, Cedars, UU Church, Bainbridge Island and Kitsap County, WA
item.description: Jaco ten Hove encourages us to transcend our narrow communities and reach across cultural lines to foster understanding and a sense of larger purpose.
item.itunes:subtitle: 1. The Transcendent Within, by Jaco B. ten Hove
item.itunes:summary: Jaco ten Hove encourages us to transcend our narrow communities and reach across cultural lines to foster understanding and a sense of larger purpose.
item.itunes:keywords: Church of the Larger Fellowship, CLF, Unitarian Universalist, UU, Progressive, Liberal Religion

item.title: CLF Quest June 2012: The God Beyond
item.itunes:author: Kaaren Anderson, Parish Co-Minister, First Unitarian Church of Rochester, NY
item.description: Kaaren Anderson posits that the biggest religious questions deal with the transcendence of the self rather than with the existence of a concrete god or gods.
item.itunes:subtitle: 2. The God Beyond, by Kaaren Anderson
item.itunes:summary: Kaaren Anderson posits that the biggest religious questions deal with the transcendence of the self rather than with the existence of a concrete god or gods.
item.itunes:keywords: Church of the Larger Fellowship, CLF, Unitarian Universalist, UU, Progressive, Liberal Religion

item.title: CLF Quest June 2012: Transcending Boundaries
item.itunes:author: Yvonne Seon
item.description: Yvonne Seon reminds us that transcendence is hard work, particularly as our personal boundaries ossify with age.
item.itunes:subtitle: 3. Transcending Boundaries, by Yvonne Seon
item.itunes:summary: Yvonne Seon reminds us that transcendence is hard work, particularly as our personal boundaries ossify with age.
item.itunes:keywords: Church of the Larger Fellowship, CLF, Unitarian Universalist, UU, Progressive, Liberal Religion

item.title: CLF Quest June 2012: Oppression
item.itunes:author: Jimmy Santiago Baca
item.description: Jimmy Santiago Baca shares a short poem inspiring the oppressed to transcend physical circumstance by fiercely restating their humanity.
item.itunes:subtitle: 4. Oppression, by Jimmy Santiago Baca
item.itunes:summary: Jimmy Santiago Baca shares a short poem inspiring the oppressed to transcend physical circumstance by fiercely restating their humanity.
item.itunes:keywords: Church of the Larger Fellowship, CLF, Unitarian Universalist, UU, Progressive, Liberal Religion

item.title: CLF Quest June 2012: From Your Minister
item.itunes:author: Meg Riley, Senior Minister, Church of the Larger Fellowship
item.description: Senior minister Meg Riley tells us to look for the transcendent not in some divine plane, but in the pain and joy interwoven in everyday life.
item.itunes:subtitle: 5. From Your Minister, by Meg Riley
item.itunes:summary: Senior minister Meg Riley tells us to look for the transcendent not in some divine plane, but in the pain and joy interwoven in everyday life.
item.itunes:keywords: Church of the Larger Fellowship, CLF, Unitarian Universalist, UU, Progressive, Liberal Religion

item.title: CLF Quest June 2012: REsources for Living
item.itunes:author: Lynn Ungar, Minister for Lifespan Learning, Church of the Larger Fellowship
item.description: Our kids' columnist Lynn Ungar clarifies the transcendentalist influence on Unitarian Universalism and explains how it can be applied today.
item.itunes:subtitle: 6. REsources for Living, by Lynn Ungar
item.itunes:summary: Our kids' columnist Lynn Ungar clarifies the transcendentalist influence on Unitarian Universalism and explains how it can be applied today.
item.itunes:keywords: Church of the Larger Fellowship, CLF, Unitarian Universalist, UU, Progressive, Liberal Religion

item.description: Susan Conrad critiques the US justice system's stress on imprisonment without rehabilitation through the lens of her work with the Alternatives to Violence Project.

item.title: CLF Quest May 2012: Justice Should Be a Thing of the Past
item.itunes:author: Timothy D. Wells, CLF Member, Clinton, New York Correctional Facility
item.description: A short poem by Timothy D. Wells encourages us to work for justice today rather that wistfully hoping for a better future.

item.itunes:author: Tom Owen-Towle, Minister Emeritus, First Unitarian Universalist Church of San Diego, CA
item.description: A reading by Tom Owen-Towle reminds us not to let our feelings about our imperfections prevent us from committing acts of kindness.

item.itunes:author: Meg Riley, Senior Minister, Church of the Larger Fellowship
item.description: Our senior minister Meg Riley tells us that justice doesn't have to be grandiose--that justice is furthered mostly though small, seemingly mundane acts.

item.itunes:summary: Our senior minister Meg Riley tells us that justice doesn't have to be grandiose--that justice is furthered mostly though small, seemingly mundane acts.

item.title: CLF Quest April 2012: Tapping Transformation
item.itunes:author: Karen Hering, Consulting Literary Minister, Unity Church-Unitarian, St. Paul, MN
item.description: Inspired by the maple tree's changing of sun and soil into sap and ultimately sweet maple syrup, Karen Hering explores how we might transform the world into a sweeter, more just planet through intential living and small acts of kindness.

item.itunes:summary: Inspired by the maple tree's changing of sun and soil into sap and ultimately sweet maple syrup, Karen Hering explores how we might transform the world into a sweeter, more just planet through intential living and small acts of kindness.
